npcs.name: Alucius Valus
utterances: Looks to me you show a bit of courage, similar to our great Overlord.
Will you take destiny into your own hands? Hmm?
Greetings, my friend. Welcome to Beggar's Court!

npcs.name: Anrean Velvinna
utterances: You can almost see the Temple of War from up here. Some day I will walk through those halls.

npcs.name: Antius Vedrix
utterances: Who are you? You're not the new guy! Get out of here!
Halt, traveler! What brings you to Beggar's Court?

npcs.name: Arms Dealer Silentblade
utterances: Is there a specific way you're looking to kill someone?  Disemboweling, beheading, impaling, strangulation?
We have a nice selection of previously owned weapons for those with modest funds.

npcs.name: Banwyn Sympronian
utterances: I'm busy with a patron. Don't bother me.

npcs.name: Cordilia
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Hello! Can I offer you one of our new lifetime extended warranties for any merchandise you purchase?

npcs.name: Cordius Sejanius
utterances: The Coalition of Tradesfolke aren't capable of serving anyone other than to serve its own greed.
The words preached by the Dismal Rage bring spiritual enlightenment to the weak.
Too often the Arcane Scientists at the academy dedicate themselves to useless knowledge that is of no use to our city.
The weak souls of the Seafury Buccaneers only cry, running to a priest when facing certain death.

npcs.name: Delcairn Sebastian
utterances: Please, leave while it still doesn't matter.

npcs.name: Durio Dexus
utterances: I'm busy. Keep walkin'.

npcs.name: Elduin Proceus
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
In spite of the cost of living, it's still quite a popular item.

npcs.name: Elowyn Equitus
utterances: Arcane Scientists couldn't navigate their way through shallow waters without a map if they tried.
Dealing with the Coalition of Tradesfolke will only burn your plunder and empty your pockets.
I don't trust the Freeport Militia. Neither should you, mate.
The Seafury Buccaneers dominate the high seas. There is no competition, matey.
The Dismal Rage is hideous I tell you. I always get the shivers when I pass by them.

npcs.name: Favonius Seneca
utterances: Mind your own business.  If you keep gawking, you'll walk away with a limp--and that's because I'm in a good mood today.

npcs.name: Festus Septimius
utterances: This glass is all hand blown and custom made. If you break it, then I break something of yours, got it?

npcs.name: Gilriel Cypria
utterances: I don't trust the Freeport Militia. Neither should you, mate.
I'd rather be stranded overboard than be converted by the dark beliefs that Dismal Rage preaches.
The Seafury Buccaneers are feared by all others on the open sea. They show no mercy to the dogs that try to sail the sea unprotected.
You might as well hand your loot to the Coalition of Tradesfolke if you ever decide to work for them.
It's weak to rely on magic for everything. If ye have the same weakness, the Academy of Arcane Sciences is for you.

npcs.name: Kaseo Volcatius
utterances: You lack the importance to address me. Away with you.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Cervaen
utterances: Yeah? Whadya need?

npcs.name: Livia Drusilla
utterances: The next time that guy leers at me, I'm gonna punch him in the throat.

npcs.name: Loamshallow
utterances: Let me guess, you're looking for poison, right?
Poison testers, it's been my biggest seller for the past several months.  Of course poison was a close second.

npcs.name: Lucius Vulso
utterances: What do you need? I've no time for small talk.

npcs.name: Lurina Galla
utterances: You had better leave before my husband gets home. I'm not supposed to have guests while he's not around.

npcs.name: Maecenus
utterances: I don't know you. Shove off.

npcs.name: Marcus Cantarius
utterances: I've dedicated my life to eradicating the dervishes.

npcs.name: Marcus Levidius
utterances: Yes, yes, hello. I'm busy.
Grim determination has gotten us to where we are now.

npcs.name: Molin Driftwater
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!
Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!

npcs.name: Nilniar Ursus
utterances: The members within the Coalition of Tradefolke are nothing more than common thieves that empty your pockets before your eyes.
The Dismal Rage is an evil entity that can destroy your soul.
The Seafuries are just a bunch of mindless sea dwellers.

npcs.name: Octavia Jovina
utterances: The priests of Dismal Rage are better at running from battle than leading one.
The Seafury Buccaneers can't be trusted. They will turn on you when you least expect it.

npcs.name: Reana Astia
utterances: Hey! Do you want some grain? Nothing's wrong with it. Come on, it'll be good for making beer or something.

npcs.name: Rilius Shadowsiege
utterances: Watch yourself, kid. You never know what unsavory creatures might lurk in the shadows of this city.

Come here, kid, and listen close. I speak about the vermin ratonga. They're an uncomfortably mysterious lot and they aren't to be trusted. Do yourself a favor and don't get involved with them. You don't want to play any part in their plots, trust me.
Everything, kid, everything. They've been here a mere twenty years and we still don't know anything about them! I mean, no one even knows where they come from!
Because the Overlord allows it, and don't think for a minute that I would dare presume to know the Overlord's state of mind again. Oh yes, I questioned his wisdom once but never again.
Oh, not much; just a decade's long incarceration with a troll for a cell mate and the stripping of my family's citizenship and welfare. But hey, at least I've still got my health.

Of course not! I would be dead if I had been so foolish! No, I've never had the pleasure of a personal audience with the Overlord. My commanding officer overheard me harping about the ratonga infestation while I was off duty.

Yes, I was there. I remember it like it was yesterday. I was on the night patrol when they first came.  It was shortly after dusk when the first of them slithered out of the sewers. It was just a few of them at first...

The city patrol was doubled and put on alert, but it was too late.  In a matter of minutes the ratonga "ambassadors" had already made their way to the doorstep of the Foci. We were ordered to remain on patrol and guard the sewer entrances, but there were no more sightings. It was quiet for a few days after that. The patrol remained on alert and we all worked triple shifts, but the damage was done.

What a logical conclusion that would be, eh? But no, she did not kill them.  Apparently, she conceded to the vermin ambassadors' requests and an audience was arranged with the Overlord. Official orders welcoming the ratonga race into the city's populace were posted and before the ink could dry, the streets were flooded with the vermin, as if they had been there, invisible, all along.

As a matter of fact, I think they have too much potential, if you know what I mean. No, I don't like them being here, not one bit and if you know what's good for you, you'll grow an extra pair of eyes in the back of your head, because they're everywhere.

npcs.name: Rolan Sunstar
utterances: Stay sharp, young one.  This city is not as safe as it may appear.
I'm a dual-breed, not a half-elf.  If you call me half-elf again, I'll cut YOU in half!
I can't wait until I'm back out at sea.  It's odd to have solid ground under my feet.
Those that go where the wind takes them can wind up lost at sea.  You seem like you've got both hands on the captain's wheel.
Don't look to me to be your next travel mate!

npcs.name: Scribe Inkwell
utterances: Curses have been a big seller.  Is there anyone in particular you're looking to torment?
So are you planning to master your art at the academy?  We keep all of the required supplies right here!
I've got scrolls here that will make your eyes pop out and your nostrils bleed!  What can I get for you?

npcs.name: Sentius Poisonleaf
utterances: This mead is quite exquisite! It's a good thing I just came into some money. I've seen what Banwyn does to people who don't pay their tab.

npcs.name: Sestius Buccio
utterances: I can't tell this pub from a pigsty.  Get to work and clean this mess!
You're slower than usual today. Have you been slippin yourself more than a few drinks under the table?

npcs.name: a Shady Thug
utterances: Prepare to face your doom, meddler.

npcs.name: Siricus Calventius
utterances: Get out of my house! I'm calling the Militia!
How dare you enter my house, scoundrel! This time you're not destroying my figurines!

npcs.name: Statia Viatrix
utterances: Those Arcane Scientists just spend way too much time studying in their confines. They need to get out more.
The Coalition of Tradesfolke sure knows how to make coins fall into their hands.
The souls of the Dismal Rage priests are so dark that their pale look will make you sick before they can ever heal you.
The Seafury Buccaneers don't seem too bright. They probably lost their ability to think from traveling the seas for too long.

npcs.name: Tabith the Hag
utterances: Stealth, guile and bravado shall follow you on your path to greatness.

npcs.name: Thavian Destrus
utterances: Make yourself at home here in Beggar's Court. Not that you'd actually want to...

npcs.name: Thesta
utterances: The stuff's over there.  Just let me know if you find anything you like.
Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!

npcs.name: Tullia Domna
utterances: A person of my fine breeding doesn't do business with lowly half-breeds. Get out of my sight, peasant.
Come hither ... how can I, Queen Antonia Bayle, serve you?
